item.title: Hytale Is Back After Being Reacquired By Hypixel Studios
item.content:encoded:
Hypixel Studios is back, and they have brought an old friend along with it. On Monday, founder Simon Collins-Laflamme announced that they had reacquired the rights to sandbox game Hytale from Riot Games.

The news comes roughly five months since it was announced that the game was being shut down.

“We are thrilled to announce that we have acquired Hytale from Riot Games,” Collins-Laflamme said. “While it didn’t make sense for them to continue developing it in its existing form, they ultimately wanted what’s best for players, and that’s for us to eventually play a revised version of the game. We are grateful to Riot Games for making this possible.”

Collins-Laflamme said that the studio has hired “more than 30 developers who know this game inside and out, with additional returns in the coming days.”

He says that the team is going to go back to the original version of what Hytale was supposed to be. It was added that the studio is fully independent and committed to funding Hytale “for the next 10 years”.

As far as what’s next, an Early Access release and pricing will be announced “in the coming days”. It’ll be available first on Windows with a Mac and Linux release possible and other platforms later on. Regarding content, the Early Access version of Hytale will include a Creative Mode, Exploration Mode, and Modding capabilities. What won’t be available are minigames and an Adventure Mode. Both of those will come later on.

What do you think of Hytale being saved and coming back at an independent Hypixel Studios? Leave your thoughts down in the comments and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming, check out our full review of SpongeBob Squares: Titans of the Tide from the perspective of both a father and son. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Helldivers CEO Comments on Switch 2 Port
item.content:encoded:
Arrowhead Games Studio’s CEO recently commented on a possible Switch 2 port for Helldivers 2, stating ‘We’ll see’.

It is no secret that Helldivers 2’s port to Xbox has significantly helped the game, with the developers revealing that the new platform has increased sales and engagement for the PC and PS5 versions of the game. So that sets a precedent for Helldivers 2 to be released on another platform, but the developers haven’t officially confirmed anything yet.

Helldivers 2 on Switch 2 Could be a Possibility?

The comments on Helldivers 2 coming to Switch 2 came through the latest episode of the Game Business Show on YouTube (via Game Rant), where Christopher Dring interviewed Shams Jorjani, Arrowhead CEO. During this interview, Dring jokingly spoke about waiting for a ‘Switch 2 version’ for the game, to which Jorjan responded, stating, “We’ll see, we’ll see. That’s again, above my pay grade by a couple of tiers.”

We already know that the Xbox port worked wonders for the game, selling more on the new platform than PlayStation in the first six days. However, will Helldivers 2 be able to find a similar kind of success on Switch 2, that is not yet known. At the same time, the developers are currently hard at work to optimise the game, working not only to address several performance issues but also to decrease the install size and improve load times.

What are your thoughts on Helldivers’ CEO commenting on a Switch 2 port? Do you think the game will ever be released for Nintendo’s new console? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Capcom expecting Resident Evil Requiem to sell better than RE Village. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: The Game Awards 2025—All Award Nominees
item.content:encoded:
The nominees for The Game Awards 2025 have been announced. For more than a decade, the show, hosted by Geoff Keighley, celebrates the year’s best games and highlights the future of the industry. With 2025 being as great a year for game releases, there were already some tight competition. Now, we know just what stood out for outlets and the judges.

All of the categories were voted on by a panel of judges from various outlets. The winners are mostly chosen by that group, but fans can vote for their favorites on the site as well. However, the biggest category that’s fully fan-voted is Player’s Voice. Nominations for the category will be announced at a later date. Last year, Astro Bot won Game of the Year, with Metaphor: ReFantazio and Balatro winning several awards as well.

You can check out the full list of 2025’s nominees below, courtesy of The Game Awards. If you’re interested in voting, you can do so on the official site here.

The Game Awards 2025 Nominations

Game of the Year

  • Clair Obscur: Expedition 33
  • Hollow Knight: Silksong
  • Donkey Kong Bananza
  • Death Stranding 2: On The Beach
  • Kingdom Come Deliverance 2
  • Hades 2

Best Game Direction

  • Supergiant Games – Hades 2
  • Hazelight Studios – Split Fiction
  • Kojima Productions and PlayStation – Death Stranding 2: On The Beach
  • Sandfall Interactive – Clair Obscur: Expedition 33
  • Sucker Punch Productions – Ghost of Yotei

Best Ongoing Game

  • No Mans Sky 
  • Fortnite 
  • Marvel Rivals
  • Final Fantasy XIV 
  • Helldivers 2 

Best Community Support

  • Helldivers 2
  • Fortnite

Best Narrative

What do you think of The Game Awards 2025 nominees? Any snubs? Dark horses? Who do you think is taking home the most awards? Game of the Year? Let us know in the comments below and on the official Insider Gaming Discord. We at Insider Gaming will be covering the event with news and winners, so stay tuned on December 11th when it all goes down.

Resident Evil Requiem is Expected to Sell Better than RE Village

Capcom expects Resident Evil Requiem to surpass RE Village’s initial sales performance. Here are more details.

Ubisoft Says People Are ‘Playing Fewer Games’, Which Makes New Games ‘Struggle to Stand Out’

In a recent financial report, Ubisoft suggested that the ways of gaming are changing and that people are playing fewer new games.

Xbox Doubles Down on Next-Gen Console and Calls It a ‘Powerful Experience’

Sarah Bond has spoken at length about the future of Xbox and dubbed the next-gen Xbox console a ‘powerful experience.’

Gabe Newell Just Bought a New $500 Million Yacht With a Basketball Court and ’15 Gaming Stations’

Gabe Newell, the co-founder of Valve, just took receipt of a $500 million yacht with a staggering amount of equipment on board.

item.title: Resident Evil Requiem is Expected to Sell Better than RE Village
item.content:encoded:
Capcom has revealed that they expect Resident Evil Requiem to exceed the sales RE Village was able to bring in.

A lot of new Resident Evil Requiem details have come out recently, thanks to developer interviews. We have been informed that the game started development ‘way before‘ RE Village, and also why they ditched the multiplayer aspect. Now, a Q&A from Capcom’s latest earnings report discusses the sales expectations for Resident Evil Requiem.

Resident Evil Requiem’s Announcement Led to Increased Sales of Previous Titles

Capcom was asked during a recent Q&A about their expectations for Resident Evil Requiem. For the former, they spoke about the title receiving “high praise at various game shows”. The devs added that with Resident Evil Requiem, they “aim to exceed the initial sales performance of the previous title, Resident Evil Village.” The developers also spoke about Requiem’s announcement leading to increased sales of previous instalments, “surpassing” their initial expectations.

During the same conference call, the developers were also asked whether Requeim will suffer from the same technical issues as Monster Hunter Wilds. The developers answered, stating both games differ “in terms of gameplay, system architecture, and network features.” At this time, the developers “do not anticipate similar risks” and are “developing the game to provide a smooth gaming experience across a wide range of PC specifications.”

In other news, the producer of Resident Evil Requiem recently addressed rumours about Leon Kennedy. Also, the release date for RE Survival Unit has been announced. Do you think Resident Evil Requiem will exceed the sales performance of RE Village? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Ubisoft stating that people are “playing fewer games,” which makes new games “struggle to stand out.” Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
